title: Fast sync fails to shutdown cleanly with error: Dangling trie nodes after full cleanup
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.10.6-stable-576681f2`
OS & Version: Windows 10

#### Expected behaviour
Running a fresh fast sync should shutdown cleanly when syncing is finished.

#### Actual behaviour
After running a fresh fast sync and performing a clean shutdown (ctrl+c) the following error occurs:
```
ERROR[08-13|03:53:30.264] Dangling trie nodes after full cleanup
```

When starting the node back up, state snapshot start, pauses and aborts in a constant loop.
```
INFO [08-13|04:00:27.283] Generating state snapshot                root=b9e802..62c64f in=5b1049..5104ad at=3648ba..a290f8 accounts=50,697,221 slots=177,225,924 storage=15.04GiB elapsed=32.026s eta=218h10m25.457s

```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
1. Download Geth 1.10.6
2. Start with `--syncmode fast`
3. Shutdown cleanly (ctrl+c) after sync finishes
4. Observe error

We don't really see any problems here, the node looks like it was syncing somewhat ok. As this ticket is fairly old (and the version it was reported on), we'll close this. Feel free to reopen if problem(s) persist

It's because Geth is generating the snapshot in the background. It's paused and resumed because chain is making progress. `Dangling trie node` error is not good, but it's irrelevant and will not corrupt your database.
